io.straas.android.sdk.streaming.interfaces

Interface EventListener


  • public interface EventListener
    EventListener provides developer events about connection of a StreamManager. You could use this by put this in StreamManager.startStreaming(io.straas.android.sdk.base.identity.Identity, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, boolean, boolean).

    All of these events would be invoked on UI thread.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onError(StreamError error, String liveId)
      Called when an error occurs when StreamManager connects to a server or streams.
      void onFinished(boolean complete)
      Called when streaming is finished by invoking StreamManager.stopStreaming() or StreamManager.destroy().
      void onStreaming(String liveId)
      Called when streaming starts.

    • Method Detail

      • onStreaming

        void onStreaming(String liveId)
        Called when streaming starts.
        Parameters:
        liveId - current streaming live event id.

      • onFinished

        void onFinished(boolean complete)
        Called when streaming is finished by invoking StreamManager.stopStreaming() or StreamManager.destroy().
        Parameters:
        complete - true if live event isn't created or is set to ended successfully, false otherwise

      • onError

        void onError(StreamError error,
             @Nullable
             String liveId)
        Called when an error occurs when StreamManager connects to a server or streams. In this case, live event won't be set to ended. If you want to end this event, you could use StreamManager.cleanLiveEvent(String, OnResultListener).
        Parameters:
        error - error type, see error
        liveId - Live event id related to this error. For example, when error type is StreamError.LIVE_COUNT_LIMIT, you will get the not ended live event id, so that you can remove it by StreamManager.cleanLiveEvent(String, OnResultListener).

        This may be null.
